result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Donald Siegel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Matthew Donald Siegel is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Matthew Donald Siegel was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To be paid as a condition of probation

May not possess or consume any intoxicants.  May not enter establishments that sell intoxicants with the exception of gas stations and grocery stores.  May enter gas stations and grocery stores but may not go into the area where intoxicants are sold.  May not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician presently treating the defendant.

NO CONTACT WITH: victim J.N. without approval of probation agent

  NO CONTACT WITH: victim Christopher O. without approval of probation agent
Defendant to undergo alcohol and other drug assessment

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
